member.name: M:Ogama.DataSet.SQLiteOgamaDataSet.UpgradeDatabase(System.ComponentModel.BackgroundWorker)
member.summary: This method renames and adds columns and tables in the given database, reflecting the changes made in the versions history
member.param: A for the progress splash window which can be cancelled and restarted when showing dialogs.
member.returns: True if upgrade was successful, and false if unsuccessful or cancelled by user.

member.name: M:Ogama.DataSet.SQLiteOgamaDataSet.RearrangeColumnLayoutInTables
member.summary: This method recreates all tables in the database except ShapeGroups, TrialEvents, SubjectParameters (they were created before) to ensure the correct column arrangement with identity column at the first index. This ensures that automatically generated insertion and select statements from the dataset will align with the correct columns.
member.remarks: Don´t say the order of the columns in an SQL database is irrelevant, this is true for handmade queries, but not for the Visual Studio auto-generated queries, which rely on the same column layout in database and mdf file.

member.name: M:Ogama.DataSet.SQLiteOgamaDataSet.MoveStimuli
member.summary: This method moves all files from the Stimuli folder to the SlideResources folder.

member.name: M:Ogama.DataSet.SQLiteOgamaDataSet.GenerateTrials(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: This method inserts for every stimulus file a new node into the slideshow tree with an id given by the stimulus index in the list. This method is only valid when no other nodes are in the slideshow already.

member.name: M:Ogama.DataSet.SQLiteOgamaDataSet.GetStimulusFiles
member.summary: This method parses the trials table for the trialIDs of the stimulus files.
member.returns: A with all stimuli files of the experiment sorted by appearance in the database.

member.name: M:Ogama.DataSet.SQLiteOgamaDataSet.AddTrialIDsforStimulusFiles(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: This method gets the StimulusFile column values and fills the empty trialID column with the index of the retreived StimulusFile to have a unique represenation for the stimulusFile.
member.param: A with the name of the table with at least has a filled column 'StimulusFile' which is filled and an empty column 'TrialID' which should be filled.

member.summary: Process any unhandled exceptions that occur in the application. This code is called by all UI entry points in the application (e.g. button click events) when an unhandled exception occurs. You could also achieve this by handling the Application.ThreadException event, however the VS2005 debugger will break before this event is called.

member.name: T:Ogama.Modules.Recording.SmartEyeInterface.SmartEyeTracker
member.summary: This class implements the class to represent an OGAMA known eye tracker. It encapsulates a Smart Eye http://www.smarteye.se Aurora eye tracker.

member.name: T:Ogama.Modules.Recording.TrackerBase.TrackerWithStatusControls
member.summary: This abstract class derives from and extends it with support for device status controls calibration plot and track status.
member.remarks: The layout and buttons for such devices are standardized, please look at the existing implementations.

member.name: T:Ogama.Modules.Recording.TrackerBase.Tracker
member.summary: This abstract class implements and and is the base class for all interfaces to hardware trackers. It is initialized with buttons of the GUI frontend and performs default tasks for default buttons and calls to the interface.
member.remarks: Every new hardware device that should be used in the recorder module of OGAMA has to be a child of this class.

member.name: T:Ogama.Modules.Recording.TrackerBase.ITracker
member.summary: This interface introduces a possibility to add new tracking hardware to the .
member.remarks: For an example how to implement this interface have a look at the four existing implementations for the tracking of mouse data and Tobii.TobiiTracker for tracking with a Tobii (www.tobii.com) system, for tracking with a Alea Technologies (www.alea-technologies.com) system and for tracking with a SMI iViewX (www.smivision.com) system. Please also refer to the source to add the new tracker to the user interface. Each tracker should have its own in the .

member.name: M:Ogama.Modules.Recording.TrackerBase.ITracker.Connect
member.summary: An implementation of this method should do all connection routines for the specific hardware, so that the system is ready for calibration.
member.returns: True if successful connected to tracker, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Ogama.Modules.Recording.TrackerBase.ITracker.Calibrate(System.Boolean)
member.summary: An implementation of this method should do the calibration for the specific hardware, so that the system is ready for recording.
member.param: whether to use recalibration or not.
member.returns: True if successful calibrated, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Ogama.Modules.Recording.TrackerBase.ITracker.Record
member.summary: An implementation of this method should start the recording for the specific hardware, so that the system sends events.

member.name: M:Ogama.Modules.Recording.TrackerBase.ITracker.Stop
member.summary: An implementation of this method should stop the recording for the specific hardware.

member.name: M:Ogama.Modules.Recording.TrackerBase.ITracker.CleanUp
member.summary: An implementation of this method should do a clean up for the specific hardware, so that the system is ready for shut down.

member.name: M:Ogama.Modules.Recording.TrackerBase.ITracker.ChangeSettings
member.summary: An implementation of this method should show a hardware system specific dialog to change its settings like sampling rate or connection properties. It should also provide a xml serialization possibility of the settings, so that the user can store and backup system settings in a separate file. These settings should be implemented in a separate class and are stored in a special place of Ogamas directory structure.
member.remarks: Please have a look at the existing implemention of the tobii system in the namespace Tobii.

member.name: M:Ogama.Modules.Recording.SmartEyeInterface.SmartEyeTracker.ChangeSettings
member.summary: An implementation of this method should show a hardware system specific dialog to change its settings like sampling rate or connection properties. It should also provide a xml serialization possibility of the settings, so that the user can store and backup system settings in a separate file. These settings should be implemented in a separate class and are stored in a special place of Ogama's directory structure.
member.remarks: Please have a look at the existing implementation of the Smart Eye system in the namespace SmartEye.

member.name: M:Ogama.Modules.Recording.SmartEyeInterface.SmartEyeTracker.Connect
member.summary: An implementation of this method should do all connection routines for the specific hardware, so that the system is ready for calibration.
member.returns: True if successful connected to tracker, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Ogama.Modules.Recording.SmartEyeInterface.SmartEyeTracker.Calibrate(System.Boolean)
member.summary: An implementation of this method should do the calibration for the specific hardware, so that the system is ready for recording.
member.param: True if calibration is in recalibration mode, indicating to renew only a few points, otherwise false.
member.returns: True if successful calibrated, otherwise false.
member.remarks: Implementations do not have to use the recalibrating parameter.

member.name: M:Ogama.Modules.Recording.ASLInterface.AslTracker.aslRawDataReceived
member.summary: Raw Data Event Handler. Throws a GazeDataChanged-Event.
member.remarks: La structure des données GazeData est déclarée dans le fichier Recording\GazeData.cs Le type GazeDataChangedEventArgs, dérivant de EventArgs, encapsulant ces informations est la classe Common\CustomEventArgs\GazeDataChangedEventArgs.cs La déclaration du delegate d'évènement GazeDataChangedEventHandler est faite dans le fichier Common\CustomEventArgs\GazeDataChangedEventArgs.cs La déclaration de l'évènement GazeDataChanged, la création de la méthode protégée, OnGazeDataChanged, destinée à "publier" l'évènement et l'abonnement à l'évènement sont faits dans la classe abstraite Recording\TrackerBase\Tracker.cs Le gestionnaire de l'évènement, la méthode associée à l'évènement, ITracker_GazeDataChanged est créée dans la classe RecordModule.cs L'évènement est signalé à la fin de cette méthode

member.name: M:Ogama.Modules.Recording.GazepointInterface.GazepointTracker.QueryPerformanceFrequency(System.UInt64@)
member.summary: Retrieves the frequency of the performance counter. The frequency of the performance counter is fixed at system boot and is consistent across all processors. Therefore, the frequency need only be queried upon application initialization, and the result can be cached.
member.param: A pointer to a variable that receives the current performance-counter frequency, in counts per second. If the installed hardware doesn't support a high-resolution performance counter, this parameter can be zero (this will not occur on systems that run Windows XP or later).
member.returns: If the installed hardware supports a high-resolution performance counter, the return value is nonzero. If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError. On systems that run Windows XP or later, the function will always succeed and will thus never return zero.

member.name: T:Ogama.Modules.Recording.Presenter.MessageHook
member.summary: This class is used to insert low level global mouse and keyboard hooks in the message loop.

member.name: F:Ogama.Modules.Recording.Presenter.MessageHook.WMKEYDOWN
member.summary: Posted to the window with the keyboard focus when a nonsystem key is pressed. A nonsystem key is a key that is pressed when the ALT key is not pressed.

member.name: F:Ogama.Modules.Recording.Presenter.MessageHook.WHMOUSELL
member.summary: The WH_MOUSE_LL hook enables you to monitor mouse input events about to be posted in a thread input queue.

member.name: F:Ogama.Modules.Recording.Presenter.MessageHook.WHKEYBOARDLL
member.summary: The WH_MOUSE_LL hook enables you to monitor mouse input events about to be posted in a thread input queue.

member.name: M:Ogama.Modules.Recording.Presenter.MessageHook.SetKeyboardHook(Ogama.Modules.Recording.Presenter.MessageHook.LowLevelProc)
member.summary: Uses SetWindowsHookEx to set a keyboard hook with the given LowLevelProc callback method.
member.param: The callback method to be called.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is the handle to the hook procedure. If the function fails, the return value is NULL.

member.name: M:Ogama.Modules.Recording.Presenter.MessageHook.SetMouseHook(Ogama.Modules.Recording.Presenter.MessageHook.LowLevelProc)
member.summary: Uses SetWindowsHookEx to set a mouse hook with the given LowLevelProc callback method.
member.param: The callback method to be called.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is the handle to the hook procedure. If the function fails, the return value is NULL.

member.name: M:Ogama.Modules.Recording.Presenter.MessageHook.UnhookWindowsHookEx(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Removes a hook procedure installed in a hook chain by the SetWindowsHookEx function.
member.param: A handle to the hook to be removed. This parameter is a hook handle obtained by a previous call to SetWindowsHookEx.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero. If the function fails, the return value is zero.

member.name: M:Ogama.Modules.Recording.Presenter.MessageHook.CallNextHookEx(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Passes the hook information to the next hook procedure in the current hook chain. A hook procedure can call this function either before or after processing the hook information.
member.param: The hook code passed to the current hook procedure. The next hook procedure uses this code to determine how to process the hook information.
The wParam value passed to the current hook procedure. The meaning of this parameter depends on the type of hook associated with the current hook chain.
The lParam value passed to the current hook procedure. The meaning of this parameter depends on the type of hook associated with the current hook chain.
member.returns: This value is returned by the next hook procedure in the chain. The current hook procedure must also return this value. The meaning of the return value depends on the hook type. For more information, see the descriptions of the individual hook procedures.

member.name: M:Ogama.Modules.Recording.Presenter.MessageHook.GetModuleHandle(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a module handle for the specified module. The module must have been loaded by the calling process.
member.param: The name of the loaded module (either a .dll or .exe file). If the file name extension is omitted, the default library extension .dll is appended.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is a handle to the specified module. If the function fails, the return value is NULL.

member.name: M:Ogama.Modules.Recording.Presenter.MessageHook.SetWindowsHookEx(System.Int32,Ogama.Modules.Recording.Presenter.MessageHook.LowLevelProc,System.IntPtr,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Installs an application-defined hook procedure into a hook chain. You would install a hook procedure to monitor the system for certain types of events. These events are associated either with a specific thread or with all threads in the same desktop as the calling thread.
member.param: The type of hook procedure to be installed.
A pointer to the hook procedure.
A handle to the DLL containing the hook procedure pointed to by the lpfn parameter.
The identifier of the thread with which the hook procedure is to be associated.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is the handle to the hook procedure. If the function fails, the return value is NULL.

member.name: T:Ogama.Modules.Recording.Presenter.MessageHook.LowLevelProc
member.summary: An application-defined or library-defined callback function used with the SetWindowsHookEx function. The system call this function every time a new mouse or keyboard input event is about to be posted into a thread input queue.
member.param: A code the hook procedure uses to determine how to process the message. If nCode is less than zero, the hook procedure must pass the message to the CallNextHookEx function without further processing and should return the value returned by CallNextHookEx
The identifier of the mouse message. This parameter can be one of the following messages: WM_LBUTTONDOWN, WM_LBUTTONUP, WM_MOUSEMOVE, WM_MOUSEWHEEL, WM_MOUSEHWHEEL, WM_RBUTTONDOWN, or WM_RBUTTONUP.
A pointer to an MSLLHOOKSTRUCT structure.
member.returns: If nCode is less than zero, the hook procedure must return the value returned by CallNextHookEx. If nCode is greater than or equal to zero, and the hook procedure did not process the message, it is highly recommended that you call CallNextHookEx and return the value it returns; otherwise, other applications that have installed WH_MOUSE_LL hooks will not receive hook notifications and may behave incorrectly as a result. If the hook procedure processed the message, it may return a nonzero # value to prevent the system from passing the message to the rest of the hook chain or the target window procedure.

member.name: T:Ogama.Modules.Recording.Presenter.MessageHook.MouseMessages
member.summary: The mouse messages that a mouse hook may receive.

member.name: F:Ogama.Modules.Recording.Presenter.MessageHook.MouseMessages.WM_LBUTTONDOWN
member.summary: The WM_LBUTTONDOWN message is posted when the user presses the left mouse button while the cursor is in the client area of a window. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:Ogama.Modules.Recording.Presenter.MessageHook.MouseMessages.WM_LBUTTONUP
member.summary: The WM_LBUTTONUP message is posted when the user releases the left mouse button while the cursor is in the client area of a window. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse

member.name: F:Ogama.Modules.Recording.Presenter.MessageHook.MouseMessages.WM_MOUSEMOVE
member.summary: The WM_MOUSEMOVEmessage is posted to a window when the cursor moves. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:Ogama.Modules.Recording.Presenter.MessageHook.MouseMessages.WM_MOUSEWHEEL
member.summary: The WM_MOUSEWHEELmessage is sent to the focus window when the mouse wheel is rotated. The DefWindowProcfunction propagates the message to the window's parent. There should be no internal forwarding of the message, since DefWindowProcpropagates it up the parent chain until it finds a window that processes it.

member.name: F:Ogama.Modules.Recording.Presenter.MessageHook.MouseMessages.WM_RBUTTONDOWN
member.summary: The WM_RBUTTONDOWNmessage is posted when the user presses the right mouse button while the cursor is in the client area of a window. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:Ogama.Modules.Recording.Presenter.MessageHook.MouseMessages.WM_RBUTTONUP
member.summary: The WM_RBUTTONUPmessage is posted when the user releases the right mouse button while the cursor is in the client area of a window. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: T:Ogama.Modules.Recording.Presenter.MessageHook.Point
member.summary: The POINT structure defines the x- and y- coordinates of a point.

member.name: F:Ogama.Modules.Recording.Presenter.MessageHook.Point.X
member.summary: The x-coordinate of the point.

member.name: F:Ogama.Modules.Recording.Presenter.MessageHook.Point.Y
member.summary: The y-coordinate of the point.

member.name: T:Ogama.Modules.Recording.Presenter.MessageHook.MSLLHOOKSTRUCT
member.summary: Contains information about a low-level mouse input event.

member.name: F:Ogama.Modules.Recording.Presenter.MessageHook.MSLLHOOKSTRUCT.Point
member.summary: The x- and y-coordinates of the cursor, in screen coordinates.

member.name: F:Ogama.Modules.Recording.Presenter.MessageHook.MSLLHOOKSTRUCT.MouseData
member.summary: If the message is WM_MOUSEWHEEL, the high-order word of this member is the wheel delta. The low-order word is reserved. A positive value indicates that the wheel was rotated forward, away from the user; a negative value indicates that the wheel was rotated backward, toward the user. One wheel click is defined as WHEEL_DELTA, which is 120. If the message is WM_XBUTTONDOWN, WM_XBUTTONUP, WM_XBUTTONDBLCLK, WM_NCXBUTTONDOWN, WM_NCXBUTTONUP, or WM_NCXBUTTONDBLCLK, the high-order word specifies which X button was pressed or released, and the low-order word is reserved. This value can be one or more of the following values. Otherwise, MouseData is not used.

member.name: F:Ogama.Modules.Recording.Presenter.MessageHook.MSLLHOOKSTRUCT.Flags
member.summary: The event-injected flag.

member.name: F:Ogama.Modules.Recording.Presenter.MessageHook.MSLLHOOKSTRUCT.Time
member.summary: The time stamp for this message.

member.name: F:Ogama.Modules.Recording.Presenter.MessageHook.MSLLHOOKSTRUCT.ExtraInfo
member.summary: Additional information associated with the message.

member.remarks: Note: You DON'T have to use this class, or anything like it. The key is the SampleCallback routine. How/where you get your bitmaps is ENTIRELY up to you. Having SampleCallback call members of this class was just the approach I used to isolate the data handling.

member.name: T:Ogama.Modules.SlideshowDesign.SlideshowModule
member.summary: The SlideshowModule.ListView.cs contains methods referring to the control at the top of the module.
The SlideshowModule.TreeView.cs contains methods referring to the control at the left of the module.
The SlideshowModule.Buttons.cs contains methods referring to the buttons at the top of the module.
Derived from . This hosts the slideshow module. This is used for the design of a slideshow presentation.
member.remarks: This interface is intended to supply tools for creating different slide shows that are suitable for OGAMA. Different types of slides are available. Instructional, pictures, graphical elements, flash stimuli and blank slides.

member.name: T:Ogama.Modules.SlideshowDesign.DesignModule.SlideDesignModule
member.summary: The SlideDesignModule.Help.cs contains the event handler for all context help buttons in the module.
The SlideDesignModule.StimuliTabs.cs contains methods referring to the at the top left of the module to define the stimuli properties that are currently selected or define new ones.
The SlideDesignModule.Common.cs contains methods referring to the at the left bottom of the module to define common properties for all slides like , Background and Mouse properties.
Inherits . This module is used for slide creation. In its user interface all slide parameters can be modified along with the creation of new slide elements.

member.name: F:Ogama.Modules.Statistics.Variables.ParamTypes.CompleteTime
member.summary: Calculates the complete fixation time at a AOI or AOI group.

member.name: F:Ogama.Modules.Statistics.Variables.ParamTypes.TimeUntil
member.summary: Calculates the time until a specific fixation on a AOI or AOI group.

member.name: F:Ogama.Modules.Statistics.Variables.ParamTypes.NumberOf
member.summary: Calculate the number of fixations in a specific AOI or AOI group.

member.name: F:Ogama.Modules.Statistics.Variables.ParamTypes.FixationDurationMean
member.summary: Calculate the average fixation duration mean in a specific AOI or AOI group.

member.name: F:Ogama.Modules.Statistics.Variables.ParamTypes.FixationDurationMedian
member.summary: Calculate the median of the fixation durations in a specific AOI or AOI group.

member.name: F:Ogama.Modules.Statistics.Variables.ParamTypes.Clicks
member.summary: Calculate the number of mouse clicks in a specific AOI or AOI group.

member.name: F:Ogama.Modules.Statistics.Variables.ParamTypes.Regressions
member.summary: Calculate regressions in a specific AOI or AOI group or over all.

member.name: F:Ogama.Modules.Statistics.Variables.ParamTypes.SaccadeDuration
member.summary: Calculate average saccade duration in a specific AOI or AOI group.

member.name: F:Ogama.Modules.Statistics.Variables.ParamTypes.SaccadeLength
member.summary: Calculate saccade length by using the distance between consecutive fixation centers in a specific AOI or AOI group.

member.name: F:Ogama.Modules.Statistics.Variables.ParamTypes.SaccadeVelocity
member.summary: Calculate saccade velocity by dividing saccade length by saccade time in a specific AOI or AOI group.

member.summary: Optional when using . The number of fixation (first, second, third) which one is interested in. Or when using the line height

member.summary: Optional when using . The that is the trigger in the database for mouse clicks that should be checked for clicks at the given AOI or AOI group.

member.name: T:Ogama.Modules.SlideshowDesign.Shuffling.CustomShuffling
member.summary: This class defines a specialized custom shuffling for the slideshow which cannot be achieved using ogamas standard shuffling options.
member.remarks: Imagine a slideshow with a root node that contains four child nodes. Each child nodes contains a list of 30 trials of the same type. No you want to build trial groups of four slides: one of each of the four sections, but randomized. That can be done with custom shuffling and will give you 30 groups each with four trials.

member.name: M:Ogama.Modules.SlideshowDesign.Shuffling.CustomShuffling.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the CustomShuffling class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the CustomShuffling class.
member.param: Indicates the parent node ID for the groups of slides that should be rearranged.
Indicates whether to shuffle the items in a section, before combining them to groups.
The number of items of a section in each group.
Indicates whether to shuffle the newly created groups before presentation.
Indicates whether to shuffle the items in a group.

member.name: M:Ogama.Modules.Common.Tools.Queries.RecreateTable(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This method creates a temporary table with the column definitions given in the parameter named dbo.Tmp_TABLENAME. Then it copies all the data from the table given by tablename into the newly created table with IDENTITY_INSERT Off. When this is done an exact copy but with correct column layout as given in 'columnDefinitions' parameter from the 'tableName' table has been created. No this method resets IDENTITY_INSERT on, drops the original table and renames the temporary table to 'tableName'. Finally one primary key constraint on the column 'ID' is created.
member.param: A with the table to be copied.
A with the SQL column definitions, e.g. [ID] [bigint] IDENTITY(1,1) NOT NULL, [SubjectName] [varchar](50) COLLATE Latin1_General_CI_AS NOT NULL, [TrialSequence] [int] NOT NULL
A with the column names separated by commas, but without the ID column e.g. SubjectName, TrialSequence, Time

member.name: T:Ogama.Modules.ImportExport.FixationData.ImportFixations
member.summary: Class for importing fixations through multiple dialogs.
member.remarks: Please note that the imported fixations are treated as gaze fixations, mouse fixations are currently not importable. This import interface is mainly created to enable the import of gaze recorder generated fixations of people that do not wan´t to rely on OGAMA´s internal fixation calculation algorithm.

member.name: F:Ogama.Modules.Recording.TobiiInterface.TobiiTracker.tobiiTrackStatus
member.summary: The TetTrackStatus is a help tool to provide a real time display of the tracking ability of the subject being eye tracked and to make it easy to verify that the subject is advantageous positioned. Preferably use it before the gaze tracking starts to verify that the eyes of the subject are found. Note that the subjects gaze point is not represented in any way, only the position of the eyes in the eye tracker sensor are shown.
member.remarks: That is from the TobiiSDK documentation.

member.name: M:Ogama.Modules.Recording.Presenter.PresenterModule.KeyboardHookCallback(System.Int32,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: This method is an implementation of the hook callback for low level keyboard message hooks.
member.param: A code the hook procedure uses to determine how to process the message. If nCode is less than zero, the hook procedure must pass the message to the CallNextHookEx function without further processing and should return the value returned by CallNextHookEx
The identifier of the mouse message. This parameter can be one of the following messages: WM_LBUTTONDOWN, WM_LBUTTONUP, WM_MOUSEMOVE, WM_MOUSEWHEEL, WM_MOUSEHWHEEL, WM_RBUTTONDOWN, or WM_RBUTTONUP.
A pointer to an MSLLHOOKSTRUCT structure.
member.returns: If nCode is less than zero, the hook procedure must return the value returned by CallNextHookEx. If nCode is greater than or equal to zero, and the hook procedure did not process the message, it is highly recommended that you call CallNextHookEx and return the value it returns; otherwise, other applications that have installed WH_MOUSE_LL hooks will not receive hook notifications and may behave incorrectly as a result. If the hook procedure processed the message, it may return a nonzero # value to prevent the system from passing the message to the rest of the hook chain or the target window procedure.

member.name: M:Ogama.Modules.Recording.Presenter.PresenterModule.MouseHookCallback(System.Int32,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: An application-defined ocallback function used with the SetWindowsHookEx function. The system call this function every time a new mouse input event is about to be posted into a thread input queue.
member.param: A code the hook procedure uses to determine how to process the message. If nCode is less than zero, the hook procedure must pass the message to the CallNextHookEx function without further processing and should return the value returned by CallNextHookEx
The identifier of the mouse message. This parameter can be one of the following messages: WM_LBUTTONDOWN, WM_LBUTTONUP, WM_MOUSEMOVE, WM_MOUSEWHEEL, WM_MOUSEHWHEEL, WM_RBUTTONDOWN, or WM_RBUTTONUP.
A pointer to an MSLLHOOKSTRUCT structure.
member.returns: If nCode is less than zero, the hook procedure must return the value returned by CallNextHookEx. If nCode is greater than or equal to zero, and the hook procedure did not process the message, it is highly recommended that you call CallNextHookEx and return the value it returns; otherwise, other applications that have installed WH_MOUSE_LL hooks will not receive hook notifications and may behave incorrectly as a result. If the hook procedure processed the message, it may return a nonzero # value to prevent the system from passing the message to the rest of the hook chain or the target window procedure.

member.name: M:Ogama.Modules.Common.Tools.FixationDetection.InitFixation(System.Int32)
member.summary: This function clears any previous, present and new fixations, and it initializes DetectFixation's internal ring buffers of prior gazepoint data. should be called prior to a sequence of calls to DetectFixation().
member.param: minimum number of gaze samples that can be considered a fixation Note: if the input value is less than 3, the function sets it to 3

member.name: M:Ogama.Modules.Common.Tools.FixationDetection.DetectFixation(System.Boolean,System.Int64,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Boolean@,System.Single@,System.Single@,System.Single@,System.Single@,System.Single@,System.Int32@,System.Int64@,System.Int64@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: This function converts a series of uniformly-sampled (raw) gaze points into a series of variable-duration saccades and fixations.
member.remarks:
Fixation analysis may be performed in real time or after the fact. To allow eye fixation analysis during real-time eyegaze data collection, the function is designed to be called once per sample. When the eye is in motion, ie during saccades, the function returns 0 (MOVING). When the eye is still, ie during fixations, the function returns 1 (FIXATING). Upon the detected completion of a fixation, the function returns 2 (FIXATION_COMPLETED) and produces: a) the time duration of the saccade between the last and present eye fixation (eyegaze samples) b) the time duration of the present, just completed fixation (eyegaze samples) c) the average x and y coordinates of the eye fixation (in user defined units of x_gaze and y_gaze) Note: Although this function is intended to work in "real time", there is a delay of minimum_fix_samples in the filter which detects the motion/fixation condition of the eye.
PRINCIPLE OF OPERATION This function detects fixations by looking for sequences of gaze- point measurements that remain relatively constant. If a new gazepoint lies within a circular region around the running average of an on-going fixation, the fixation is extended to include the new gazepoint. (The radius of the acceptance circle is user specified by setting the value of the function argument gaze_deviation_threshold.) To accommodate noisy eyegaze measurements, a gazepoint that exceeds the deviation threshold is included in an on-going fixation if the subsequent gazepoint returns to a position within the threshold. If a gazepoint is not found, during a blink for example, a fixation is extended if a) the next legitimate gazepoint measurement falls within the acceptance circle, and b) there are less than minimum_fix_samples of successive missed gazepoints. Otherwise, the previous fixation is considered to end at the last good gazepoint measurement.
NITS OF MEASURE The gaze position/direction may be expressed in any units (e.g. millimeters, pixels, or radians), but the filter threshold must be expressed in the same units.
INITIALIZING THE FUNCTION Prior to analyzing a sequence of gazepoint data, the InitFixation function should be called to clear any previous, present and new fixations and to initialize the ring buffers of prior gazepoint data.
PROGRAM NOTES For purposes of describing an ongoing sequence of fixations, fixations in this program are referred to as "previous", "present", and "new". The present fixation is the one that is going on right now, or, if a new fixation has just started, the present fixation is the one that just finished. The previous fixation is the one immediatly preceeding the present one, and a new fixation is the one immediately following the present one. Once the present fixation is declared to be completed, the present fixation becomes the previous one, the new fixation becomes the present one, and there is not yet a new fixation.
member.param: flag indicating whether or not the image processing algo detected the eye and computed a valid gazepoint (TRUE/FALSE)
Current sample timing value in ms.
x-coordinate of present gazepoint (user specified units)
y-coordinate of present gazepoint (user specified units)
distance that a gazepoint may vary from the average fixation point and still be considered part of the fixation (user specified units)
minimum number of gaze samples that can be considered a fixation. Note: if the input value is less than 3, the function sets it to 3
Delayed Gazepoint data with fixation annotations: sample gazepoint-found flag, min_fix_samples ago
deviation of the gaze from the present fixation, min_fix_samples ago
x-coordinate of fixation point as estimated, min_fix_samples ago
y-coordinate of fixation point as estimated, min_fix_samples ago
duration of the saccade preceeding the preset fixation (samples)
duration of the present fixation in ms
member.returns: MOVING 0 The eye was in motion min_fix_samples ago. FIXATING 1 The eye was fixating min_fix_samples ago. FIXATION_COMPLETED 2 A completed fixation has just been detected, the fixation ended min_fix_samples ago.

member.name: T:Ogama.Modules.AttentionMap.AttentionMapModule
member.summary: Derived from . This is the class for the attention map module. This class handles the UI and the database connection for the class, which is the main element of this form.
member.remarks: This module is intended to calculate gaussian distributions of the fixational data and overlay it on the output stimulus image, so that you can see a landscape of visited and unvisited locations on the stimulus. You can choose the subjects to include in the calculation and whether the calculation should be based only on a special or all fixations.

member.name: T:Ogama.Modules.Statistics.StatisticsModule
member.summary: Inherits This class is the statistics module. This class calculates a lot of parameters useful for further analysis. The parameters can be selected in the form and are generated by filling a datagrid view. This data grid can be exported to a SPSS readable format.
member.remarks: Calculation is done only for the selected subjects.

member.name: T:Ogama.Modules.Fixations.FixationsModule
member.summary: Derived from . This is the fixations module. It handles the UI and the database connection for the class, which is the main element of this form.
member.remarks: This interface is intended to calculate and display the gaze and mouse fixations made by the subjects. There are several display modes and a data grid view which shows the calculated fixations. The calculation uses the fixation detection algorithms available from Company: LC Technologies, Inc. 1483 Chain Bridge Road, Suite 104 McLean, VA 22101 (703) 385-7133 that are ported to C# in the class .

member.summary: Derived from . This hosts the replay module. It handles the user interface and the database connection for the , which is the main element of this form.
member.remarks: This interface is intended to replay the data that is logged during the experiment. A lot of settings can be made, concerning the visualization of the data. Also a video export is implemented.

member.name: T:Ogama.Modules.Database.DatabaseModule
member.summary:
Derived from . This is the database module. It displays all tables from the database:
The user can edit and revise the tables.
member.remarks: This module is intended to give the option to take a look at all of the databasis entries, that are made during recording, import or calculation, to see what is stored in behind the user interface. It contains the basis for all visualization and is the module with the import assistant for raw data.

member.name: T:Ogama.Modules.AOI.AOIModule
member.summary: Derived from . This form hosts the areas of interest module. (AOI) This class handles the UI and the database connection for the class, which is the main element of this form.
member.remarks: This module is intended to define and display areas of interest (AOI) on the given stimulus images. The defined AOI then can be edited and copied in a data grid view. There is also the possibility to import a list of AOI from a text file. OGAMA knows ellipsoid, rectangular and polylineal shapes for AOI.

member.name: T:Ogama.Properties.Settings
member.summary: Program and user settings class provided by Visual Studio. Main part is automatically generated by properties window. Has application and user scoped form designer generated settings.
member.remarks: This class also allows you to handle specific events on the settings class: The SettingChanging event is raised before a setting's value is changed. The PropertyChanged event is raised after a setting's value is changed. The SettingsLoaded event is raised after the setting values are loaded. The SettingsSaving event is raised before the setting values are saved. For custom settings on experiments refer to the class .

member.name: M:Ogama.Properties.Settings.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Settings class.

member.name: T:Ogama.Modules.Recording.TobiiInterface.TobiiSetting
member.summary: Class to save settings for the tobii eye tracking system. It is XML serializable and can be stored in a file via the class. XmlSerializer serializer = new XmlSerializer(typeof(TobiiSetting));

member.name: F:Ogama.Modules.Recording.TobiiInterface.TobiiSetting.connectedTrackerName
member.summary: Saves the name of the connected tobii tracking system.

member.name: F:Ogama.Modules.Recording.TobiiInterface.TobiiSetting.tetNumCalibPoints
member.summary: Saves the number of calibration points.

member.name: F:Ogama.Modules.Recording.TobiiInterface.TobiiSetting.tetCalibPointSize
member.summary: Saves the calibration point size.

member.name: F:Ogama.Modules.Recording.TobiiInterface.TobiiSetting.tetCalibPointSpeed
member.summary: Saves the calibration speed.

member.name: F:Ogama.Modules.Recording.TobiiInterface.TobiiSetting.tetPointColor
member.summary: Saves the color for the calibration points.

member.name: F:Ogama.Modules.Recording.TobiiInterface.TobiiSetting.tetBackgroundColor
member.summary: Saves the background color of the calibration procedure.

member.name: F:Ogama.Modules.Recording.TobiiInterface.TobiiSetting.tetRandomizeCalibPointOrder
member.summary: Saves the flag, whether the calibration point order should be randomized.

member.name: M:Ogama.Modules.Recording.TobiiInterface.TobiiSetting.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the TobiiSetting class.

member.name: P:Ogama.Modules.Recording.TobiiInterface.TobiiSetting.ConnectedTrackerName
member.summary: Gets or sets the connected Tobii trackers name.

member.name: P:Ogama.Modules.Recording.TobiiInterface.TobiiSetting.TetNumCalibPoint
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of calibration points that are shown.
member.remarks: 5 are standard, 9 gives higher precision, 2 are for uncooperative subjects.
member.value: A with the number of points, can be (2,5,9).

member.name: P:Ogama.Modules.Recording.TobiiInterface.TobiiSetting.TetCalibPointSizes
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the calibration point to change its place.
member.value: A which is small, medium or large.

member.name: P:Ogama.Modules.Recording.TobiiInterface.TobiiSetting.TetCalibPointSpeeds
member.summary: Gets or sets the speed of the Calibration point.
member.value: A which is between fast and slow.

member.name: P:Ogama.Modules.Recording.TobiiInterface.TobiiSetting.TetCalibPointColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the circles marking the calibration points. The default value is red.
member.value: A for the calibration points, which is converted into a OLE_COLOR Structure.

member.name: P:Ogama.Modules.Recording.TobiiInterface.TobiiSetting.SerializedTetCalibPointColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the . Serializes and deserializes the to XML, because XMLSerializer can not serialize values.

member.name: P:Ogama.Modules.Recording.TobiiInterface.TobiiSetting.TetCalibBackgroundColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the calibration window background.
member.value: A for the background, which is converted into a OLE_COLOR Structure.

member.name: P:Ogama.Modules.Recording.TobiiInterface.TobiiSetting.SerializedTetCalibBackgroundColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the . Serializes and deserializes the to XML, because XMLSerializer can not serialize values.

member.name: P:Ogama.Modules.Recording.TobiiInterface.TobiiSetting.TetRandomizeCalibPointOrder
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether calibration point order should be randomized or not.
member.value: A indicating the randomizing of the calibration points.
